name: Rothenburg ob der Tauber
fun_fact: Fun fact: Rothenburg's famous Schneeballen (snowball pastries) were originally reserved for weddings and church consecration festivals in the 18th century, not for everyday consumption. Today, the town has competing bakeries that have been hand-forming these fried dough balls for over 100 years.

hero_dishes.name: Schneeballen (Snowball Pastry)
hero_dishes.description: Deep-fried shortcrust pastry strips arranged in a crisscross pattern around a special iron form, creating a crispy ball 8-10cm in diameter, traditionally dusted with powdered sugar
hero_dishes.origin_story: Known in Franconia and Hohenlohe for at least 400 years, these pastries were served at weddings and Kirchweih festivals since the early 18th century. The name comes from their snowball-like appearance and white powdered sugar coating. Also called 'Storchennest' (stork's nest).
